org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.support
Class AeRepeatableOnAlarm

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.AeAbstractBpelObject
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.support.AeActivityParent
          org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.support.AeBaseEvent
              org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.support.AeOnAlarm
                  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.support.AeRepeatableOnAlarm
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeActivityParent, IAeAlarmReceiver, IAeBpelObject, IAeDynamicScopeParent, IAeExecutableBpelObject, IAeExecutableQueueItem, IAeFunctionFactory, IAeLocatableObject, IAeNamespaceContext, IAeVisitable
public class AeRepeatableOnAlarm
extends AeOnAlarm
implements IAeDynamicScopeParent

Implementation of a repeatable alarm for use when a scope onAlarm contains the repeatEvery syntax.

Field Summary
private  java.util.List mChildren
          list of child scope instances created during onAlarm routines

          list of child scope instances that have been restored for compensation purposes
private  int mInstanceValue
          value for the next scope instance created for this onAlarm

          calculated interval for the repeatEvery expression

addActivity

public void addActivity(IAeActivity aActivity)
Description copied from interface: IAeActivityParent
Adds the activity to this parent. The method implies that there may be more than 1 activity as a child of this parent. This is a side effect of deciding to have a single interface to handle cases with a single child and those with multiple children.

Description copied from interface: IAeBpelObject

For structured activities, this merely returns an Iterator for the child activity or activities. In some cases though, like Scope, we're returning objects in addition to the single child activity.
